notes: Tested SKBitmap.Decode with multiple PNG types (16-bit RGB, 8-bit RGBA, 8-bit colormap/palette, large 8-bit RGBA) across SkiaSharp 2.88.3, 2.88.6, 3.119.2, and main (source). All decodes succeeded on all versions. Also tested edge cases: truncated PNGs (10%, 50%, 90%), empty files, header-only files, and non-existent paths — all behaved correctly. The reporter's specific PNG file (image1.png) was never attached to the issue, making it impossible to reproduce the exact failure. The original #933/#1981 was a zlib SSE decompression bug fixed in 2.88.1. Without the reporter's specific image, we cannot determine whether their PNG triggers a different code path. The reporter was asked (via triage) to provide the sample file but never responded.

versionResults.notes: All 4 PNG types decoded successfully via SKBitmap.Decode(string), SKCodec.Create(stream), and SKBitmap.Decode(SKData).
All 4 PNG types decoded successfully. Same results as 2.88.3.
All 4 PNG types decoded successfully on latest stable release.
Ran 7 existing decode-related tests (CanDecodePotentiallyCorruptPngFiles, CanDecodeImageStreams, TestBitmapDecodeDrawsCorrectly) — all passed.

reproductionSteps.description: Create standalone console project with SkiaSharp 2.88.3 and copy test PNG files (baboon.png 16-bit RGB, color-wheel.png 8-bit RGBA, index8.png 8-bit colormap, testimage.png 8-bit RGBA)
reproductionSteps.command: dotnet new console -n Repro --framework net8.0 && cd Repro && dotnet add package SkiaSharp --version 2.88.3
reproductionSteps.output:
The template "Console App" was created successfully.
PackageReference for package 'SkiaSharp' version '2.88.3' added.

artifacts.description: Reporter's PNG file that fails to decode. Never attached to the issue — this is the critical missing artifact preventing reproduction.

triageCorrections.upstream: Triage recommended requesting sample image (actionability: request-info, confidence 0.90)
triageCorrections.corrected: Confirmed: without the reporter's specific PNG file, the bug cannot be reproduced. All standard PNG types (16-bit RGB, 8-bit RGBA, 8-bit colormap) and edge cases (truncated, large, empty) decode correctly across all tested versions.
